contents.text: A tourist wants to go to the Brooklyn Museum and asks a passerby for directions .
contents.text_zh: 一位游客想去参观布鲁克林博物馆，并向一位过路人问路。

contents.text: Excuse me ...could you tell me if this is where I can catch a bus to the Brooklyn Museum ?
contents.text_zh: 对不起...你能告诉我是否能在这儿乘坐去布鲁克林博物馆的公共汽车？

contents.text: Yes ,you’re at the right stop,but that bus comes only every half hour to 45 minutes .Besides, I don’t think it goes directly to Brooklyn,I know it makes a lot of stops .
contents.text_zh: 是的，你刚好在车站，但是这趟车要半个小时到45分钟发一次，另外，我想它不直接到达布鲁克林，据我听知，沿路它要停好多站。

contents.text: Sounds like it takes a long time to get there .
contents.text_zh: 听起来好像要花很长时间才能到那儿。

contents.text: It does ...especially at this time of day when the traffic is heavy .Why don’t you take the subway? It’s a lot faster .
contents.text_zh: 确实...尤其是一天中的这会儿交通高峰时刻。你为什么不乘地铁去？那样要快得多。

contents.text: I just can’t seem to understand the New York subway system at all.As soon as I get   underground I lose my sense of direction .
contents.text_zh: 我根本就不了解纽约的地铁系统，我一到地铁站就失去方向感了。

contents.text: But it’s easy to get to Brooklyn from here.
contents.text_zh: 从这到布鲁克林很容易。

contents.text: Well...do you know where the nearest  subway station is ?
contents.text_zh: 行...你能告诉我最近的地铁站在哪儿？

contents.text: About a block down from here. Say,I’m going in that direction.I’ll show you where it is.
contents.text_zh: 离这儿有一个街区。我正朝着那个方向走。我来指给你看，在那儿。

contents.text: Think nothing of it .The museum’s about eight stops down . You get off at Eastern parkway. And you don’t have to make any changes.
contents.text_zh: 别客气。大约有8站路就到博物馆了，你在东方公园路下车，并且不必改变任何方向。

contents.text: It sounds easy.Maybe this time I won’t get lost !
contents.text_zh: 听起来还算容易，也许这次我不会迷路了。
